page.title: 16Oakley's important buildings
page.content: Oakley village hall was an ex railway hut from the Great Western line between Brill and Ludgershall.It was given to the village by Sir Henry Verney.Oakley shop sells all sorts of food and provisions.Our school was opened in 1958,and was extended in 1968 to enclude the tower blok.There used to be a school in School Lane with the headmistress's house next door.Oakley garage is very near our school.It is not self-service but sells petrol and does servicing. In Oakley there are two pubs -The Chandos Arms and The Royal Oak.The Foresters pub closed in 1915.The Sun is also closed, it is a house.The cellar is still part of the house and the old sign hangs on the front door.The Post Office has recently moved from the old bakery to the Turnpike.
